<script>
function menus_sliding(arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4, arg5){
var a="#" + arg1, b="#" + arg3,c="#" + arg4,d="#" + arg5;
$(document).ready(function(){
$(b).slideUp();
$(c).slideUp();
$(d).slideUp();
$(a).slideDown();
$(".nav_pulldown").animate({ height: (arg2)}, 500);

});
}

$(document).ready(function(){
$(".nav_pulldown").mouseleave(function(){
 $(".va_sub_menus").slideUp();
 $(".nav_pulldown").animate({ 
            height: (101)
        }, 500);
});
});
</script>


<div class="navigation">

		03 May 2013</span></p>
	<p class="IE7_bookSection"><label>Imprint:</label> <span itemprop="publisher">Elsevier Science</span></p>
	<p class="IE7_bookSection">
				<label>Print Book ISBN :</label>
					<span itemprop="isbn">9780123869807</span> 
				</p>
			<p class="IE7_bookSection"><label>eBook ISBN :</label>
										<span itemprop="isbn">9780123870124</span> </p>
								<p class="IE7_bookSection"><label>Pages:</label> 944</p>
	<p class="IE7_bookSection"><label>Dimensions:</label> 276 X 216</p>
	<p class="product_description IE7_bookSection"><P>In one accessible volume, this book presents the most significant original works from the 4-volume set of A.M Turing's collected works, along with key commentary from the great scholarly leaders in the field, providing interested readers with unique insight into the context and significance of Turing's impact on mathematics, computing, computer science, informatics, morphogenesis, philosophy and the wider scientific world. </P></p>

;trackAdd()" type="submit"><input name="_D:/atg/commerce/order/ESTShoppingCartModifier.addBookToOrder" value=" " type="hidden"><a class="right add_to_cart button_grey OrangeBtn"
																		href="javascript:void(0)" id="addToCartIngram" onclick="copyCurrentSelection();addToCart('9780123870124', '0');trackAdd()">Add to Cart</a>
																					
																		<input name="_DARGS" value="/common/include/addToCartIngram.jsp" type="hidden"></input></form><script type="text/javascript">
		
		function copyCurrentSelection() {
			$("input:radio").each(function() {
				var dd = "#" + this.id;
				if($(dd).is(':checked')) { 
					var theId = this.id;
					var theIsbn = $(dd).attr('rIsbn');
					var theIndex = $(dd).attr('rIndex');
					updateSKUIngram(theId, theIndex, theIsbn);
				}
			});
		}
		
	</script>

	<div class="threecolumn relative"><!-- Start Tabs -->

	<div id="tabs">

	<ul class="tabblocks">
		<li id="head-tab1">
		<h3 class="kk"><a href="#tabs-1">Overview</a></h3>
		</li>
		<li id="head-tab2">
		<h3 class="kk"><a href="#tabs-2">Authors</a></h3>
		</li>
		<li id="head-tab3">
		<h3 class="kk"><a href="#tabs-3">Table of Contents</a></h3>
		</li>
		<li id="head-tab4">
		<h3 class="kk"><a href="#tabs-4">Video</a></h3>
		</li>
		<li id="head-tab5">
		<h3 class="kk"><a href="#tabs-5">Resources</a></h3>
		</li>
		<li id="head-tab6">
		<h3 class="kk"><a href="#tabs-6">Editorial Reviews</a></h3>
		</li>
	</ul>

	<div id="tabs-1" class="content"><h2 class="content_title" class="mediumgrey">Key Features</h2>
			<p>
				<UL>
<LI>Affordable, key collection of the most significant papers by A.M. Turing.</LI>
<LI>Commentary explaining the significance of each seminal paper by preeminent leaders in the field. </LI>
<LI>Additional resources available online.</LI></UL></p>
		<h2 class="content_title"  class="mediumgrey">Description</h2>
			<p>
				<P><EM>"The fact remains that everyone who taps at a keyboard, opening a spreadsheet or a word-processing program, is working on an incarnation of a Turing machine."-</EM><EM>TIME</EM></P>
<P>In this accessible new selection of writings by Information Age pioneer Alan Turing, readers will find many of the most significant contributions from the four-volume set of the <EM>Collected Works of A. M. Turing</EM>. These contributions, together with commentaries from current experts in a wide spectrum of fields and backgrounds, provide insight on the significance and contemporary impact of A.M. Turing's work. </P>
<P>Offering a more modern perspective than anything currently available, <EM>Alan Turing: His Work and Impact</EM> gives wide coverage of the many ways in which Turing's scientific endeavors have impacted current research and understanding of the world. His pivotal writings on subjects including computing, artificial intelligence, cryptography, morphogenesis, and more display continued relevance and insight into today's scientific and technological landscape. This collection provides a great service to researchers, but is also an approachable entry point for readers with limited training in the science, but an urge to learn more about the details of Turing's work.</P></p>
		<p class="content_title">Readership</p>
			<p>
				<P>Researchers and scientists interested in the context and significance of Turing's impact on artificial intelligence, artificial neural networks, morphogenesis, cryptology, the philosophy of mind, mathematics, computing, computer science, informatics, morphogenesis, philosophy and the wider scientific world. </P></p>
		</div>
	<div id="tabs-2" class="content"><div id="authtabs">
							<ul class="multi_author borderBot1 clearfix">
								<li>
										<a class="authlink lightgray" id="authlink1" href="javascript:void(0)">S.&nbsp;Cooper</a>
										<span class="sep">|</span>
										</li>	
								<li>
										<a class="authlink " id="authlink2" href="javascript:void(0)">J.&nbsp;van Leeuwen</a>
										</li>	
								</ul>
				<div id="authtab1" class="author_tab active">
								<div class="author_descri noimg">
									<h3 class="author_name">S.&nbsp;Cooper</h3>
									<p class="author_grade darkblue"></p>
									<p></p>
									
									<p class="author_area">Affiliations and Expertise</p>
										<p>Professor of Mathematical Logic, University of Leeds, Leeds, UK</p>
									</div>

				</div>
				</div>
	<div id="tabs-3" class="content"><p class="content_title_2">Alan Turing: His Work and Impact, 1st Edition</p>
				<P>Part I: How Do We Compute? What Can We Prove?<BR>1.Alan Mathison Turing<BR>2.On Computable Numbers, with an Application to the Entscheidungsproblem<BR>3.On Computable Numbers, with an Application to the Entscheidungsproblem - correction<BR>4.Review of Turing 1936-7<BR>5.Computability and ?-definability<BR>6.The p-function in ?-K-conversion<BR>7.Systems of Logic based on Ordinals<BR>8.A Formal Theorem in Church's Theory of Types<BR>9.The Use of Dots as Brackets in Church's System<BR>10.Practical Forms of Type Theory<BR>11.The Reform of Mathematical Notation</P>
<P>Part II: Hiding and Unhiding Information: Cryptology, Complexity and Number Theory.<BR>1.On the Gaussian Error Function<BR>2.A Method for the Calculation of the Zeta-function<BR>3.Some Calculations of the Riemann Zeta-function<BR>4.On a Theorem of Littlewood<BR>5.The Word Problem in Semi-groups with Cancellation<BR>6.Solvable and Unsolvable Problems<BR>7.The Word Problem in Compact Groups<BR>8.On Permutation Groups<BR>9.Rounding-off Errors in Matrix Processes<BR>10.A Note on Normal Numbers<BR>11.Turing's treatise on the Enigma (Prof's Book); Report by Turing on U. S. Navy cryptanalytic work and their machinery, November 1942; Speech System 'Delilah' - report on progress, 6 June 1944; Checking a Large Routine; An early program proof by Alan Turing; Programmers' Handbook for the Manchester electronic computer; Local Programming Methods and Conventions</P>
<P>Part III: Building a Brain: Intelligent Machines, Practice and Theory.<BR>1.Lecture to the London Mathematical Society<BR>2.Intelligent Machinery<BR>3.Computing Machinery and Intelligence<BR>4.Chess; Solvable and Unsolvable Problems<BR>5.Intelligent Machinery: A heretical theory; Can digital computers think?; Can automatic calculating machines be said to think?<BR>6.Some Remarks on the Undecidability Results</P>
<P>Part IV: The Mathematics of Emergence: The Mysteries of Morphogenesis.<BR>1.The Chemical Basis of Morphogenesis<BR>2.A Diffusion Reaction Theory of Morphogenesis in Plants<BR>3.Morphogen Theory of Phyllotaxis; Geometrical and Descriptive Phyllotaxis; Chemical Theory of Morphogenesis; A Solution of the Morphogenetical Equations for the Case of Spherical Symmetry<BR>4.Outline of the Development of the Daisy<BR></P>
<P>&nbsp;</P><div class="clearline"><!----></div>
			</div>
	<div id="tabs-4" class="tabcarousel content"><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
 
   var player_version = 'full_thumbnails';
 
//]]>
</script>

  </div>
	<div id="tabs-5" class="content"><!--Mantis: 2171: E+P Starts-->
					
					<div class="bottomDotted">
			      <div class="clearline"><!----></div>
			  </div>
			  <div>
			      <div class="clearline"><!----></div>
			  </div>
		<!-- Mantis: 2171: E+P ends -->
	      
	    
</div>
	<div id="tabs-6" class="content"><div class="quote_container">
			<div class="quote_text">
			<h4 class="mediumgrey">Quotes and reviews</h4>
			<P><EM>"much of whats presented is for specialistsBut theres still plenty even for a non-mathematician like me, some of it surprisingly movingno matter how well you know the life and work of Turing, youll learn something from this book."--</EM><STRONG><EM>OECD Insights blog,</EM> August 26, 2013</STRONG><BR><EM>"This accessible book is an essential read for those interested in Turings work and provides a more contemporary perspective than anything else that is available."--</EM><STRONG><EM>CyberTalk,</EM> September 2013</STRONG><BR><EM>"This volume contains a mix of writings - some excerpts by Turing, but mostly writings about him and his work by those who understand his genius and his legacy. The writings include first person narratives of what he was like and what it was like to work with him, personal accounts of career-changing encounters with his thinking, and commentary on particular aspects of his work."--</EM><STRONG><EM>Reference and Research Book News,</EM> August 2013<BR></STRONG><EM>"The new testament of computer science has come, 101 years after the birth of founding prophet Alan TuringHow big is the incomputable universe? Can digital machines think? Do daisies emerge from pure chemistry? If your soul craves answers to such questions, this is your new bible."--</EM><STRONG><EM>Nature,</EM> June 19, 2013<BR></STRONG>"<STRONG><EM>Alan Turing: His Work and Impact </EM></STRONG>makes Turing's most important papers readily accessible and affordable. With the four volumes of the previously published "Collected Works" now scarce and very expensive, this volume fills a pressing need in Turing scholarship.&nbsp;Moreover, the commentaries associated with Turing's papers in this volume offer new and compelling insights into the continuing importance and relevance of Turing's work, contextualizing it in contemporary contexts and providing richly elaborated explanations of how and why Turing's work remains seminal for a wide variety of fields, including computational science, cognitive science, artificial intelligence and more." -- <EM><STRONG>N. Katherine Hayles, Professor of Literature, Duke University</STRONG></EM></P></div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>

			 function RightslinkPopUp()      {  
			
				var url = "https://s100.copyright.com/AppDispatchServlet"; 
			 var location = url 
					+ "?publisherName=" + encodeURI ('ELS')
					+ "&publication=" + encodeURI ('Elsevier Science')
					+ "&title=" + encodeURI ('Alan Turing: His Work and Impact, 1st Edition') 
					+ "&publicationDate=" + encodeURI ('03 May 2013') 
					+ "&author=" + encodeURI ('')
					+ "&copyright=" + encodeURI ('2013')
					+ "&contentID=" + encodeURI ('9780123869807')
								PopUp = window.open( location,'Rightslink','location=no,toolbar=no,directories=no,status=no,menubar=no,scrollbars=yes,resizable=yes,width=650,height=550');
				}

							
        </script>

<script type="text/javascript">
	

	jQuery(document).ready(function() {
		surveyInvite();
	});
	
	var cookieIdentifier = "StoreExitSurvey20121130";
	var cookieLifetimeInDays = "30";
	var exitSurveyLink = 'http://survey.confirmit.com/wix/p2244762436.aspx';
	var exitSurveyChance = 1; // 0.5 = 50% chance, 1 = 100% chance
	
	function surveyInvite() {
		if (getCookie(cookieIdentifier) != "true") {
			
			if (Math.random() <= exitSurveyChance) {
				setCookie(cookieIdentifier, "true", cookieLifetimeInDays)
				
				elementHTML = jQuery('#exitsurvey_template').html();
				surveyDiv = jQuery('<div id="exitsurvey_container" class="exitsurvey_container"/ style="display:none;">'),
				surveyDiv.html(elementHTML);
				
				jQuery('body').append(surveyDiv);
				jQuery('#exitsurvey_container').show();
				
				// 2 seconds after the page is loaded slide survey box into view
				jQuery('#exitsurvey_container').delay(2000).animate({"bottom": "+=172px"}, 1000, "swing", function() {
					// do nothing for now...
				});
			}
		}
	}

	function surveyAccept() {
		var page = "http://" + window.location.hostname;
		var windowprops = "width=100,height=100,location=no,toolbar=no,menubar=no,scrollbars=yes,resizable=yes";
		var PopWindow = window.open(page, "_blank", "", windowprops);
		
		window.setTimeout(window.focus, 500);
		
		if (PopWindow) {
			exitSurveyHTML = getNewWindowHTML();
			PopWindow.document.write(exitSurveyHTML);
			PopWindow.document.close( );
			
			if (navigator.userAgent.indexOf('Chrome/') > 0){
				window.focus();
			}
			
			PopWindow.blur();
			
			if (navigator.userAgent.indexOf('Firefox/4') > 0){
				window.open("", "_self", "");
			}
		}

		surveyClose();
	}
	
	function surveyClose(){
		jQuery('#exitsurvey_container').hide();
	}
	
	function getNewWindowHTML(){
		windowHTML = '';
		windowHTML += '<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">';
		windowHTML += '<html>';
		windowHTML += '<head><title>Feedback</title></head>';
		windowHTML += '<body>';
		windowHTML += '<p style="text-align:center;">Thank you for agreeing to take our short survey.<br>Your survey will start here when you close the Elsevier Store Tab in your browser.</p>';
		windowHTML += '<script type="text/javascript">';
		windowHTML += 'var i;';
		windowHTML += 'var lastseen = window.opener.location.hostname;';
		windowHTML += 'function CheckParent() {';
		windowHTML += 'try {';
		windowHTML += 'var host = window.opener.location.hostname;';
		windowHTML += 'if (host != lastseen){';
		windowHTML += 'lastseen = host;';
		windowHTML += '}';
		windowHTML += 'return;';
		windowHTML += '} catch(error){';
		windowHTML += 'clearInterval(i);';
		windowHTML += 'moveTo(screen.width/2-450,screen.height/2-300);';
		windowHTML += 'resizeTo(900,600);';
		windowHTML += 'this.focus();';
		windowHTML += 'if (navigator.appName != "Microsoft Internet Explorer") {';
		windowHTML += 'alert("Click ok to begin your survey");';
		windowHTML += '}';
		windowHTML += 'this.location="' + exitSurveyLink + '";';
		windowHTML += '}';
		windowHTML += '}';
		windowHTML += 'i = setInterval("CheckParent()", 500);';
		windowHTML += '<\/script>';
		windowHTML += '<\/body>';
		windowHTML += '<\/html>';
		
		return windowHTML;
	}
	
	// Cookie helper functions
	function setCookie(c_name,value,exdays){
		var exdate=new Date();
		exdate.setDate(exdate.getDate() + exdays);
		var c_value=escape(value) + ((exdays==null) ? "" : "; expires="+exdate.toUTCString());
		document.cookie=c_name + "=" + c_value;
	}

	function getCookie(c_name){
		var i,x,y,ARRcookies=document.cookie.split(";");
		for (i=0;i<ARRcookies.length;i++) {
			x=ARRcookies[i].substr(0,ARRcookies[i].indexOf("="));
			y=ARRcookies[i].substr(ARRcookies[i].indexOf("=")+1);
			x=x.replace(/^\s+|\s+$/g,"");
			if (x==c_name){
				return unescape(y);
			}
		}
	}
</script>
<p><style type="text/css">
	.exitsurvey_container {
		border:solid;
		border-width:1px;
		margin-top:160px;
		border-color:#9b9b9b;
		width:420px;
		position:fixed;
		bottom:-162px;
		/*right:10px;*/
		right:10px;
		z-index:150;
	}
	
	.exitsurvey_container .exitsurvey_header {
		background-color:#e8e8e8;
		color:#000000;
		padding:10px;
		font-size:1.35em;
		font-weight:bold
	}
	
	.exitsurvey_container .exitsurvey_content {
		padding:10px;
		background-color:#ffffff;
	}
	
	.exitsurvey_container .exitsurvey_close {
		background: url("http://secure-ecsd.elsevier.com/est/sprite_search.gif") no-repeat scroll 0 -130px transparent;
		width: 19px;
		height: 16px;
		position: absolute;
		right: 5px;
		top: 5px;
		display: block;
	}</style></p>
<div class="exitsurvey_container" id="exitsurvey_template" style="display: none">
<div class="exitsurvey_header">Thank you for visiting Elsevier Store today</div>
<div class="exitsurvey_content">
<p>We'd like to ask you to provide feedback on your experience with Elsevier Store today. Your feedback will be used to enhance the site in the future.</p>
<p style="margin-top: 10px">Would you be willing to answer a few questions <span style="text-decoration: underline">when you leave our site?</span></p>
<p style="margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 10px; text-align: center"><a href="javascript:surveyAccept();">Yes, I'm willing to take part in a survey</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="javascript:surveyClose();">No, thank you</a></p>
</div>
</div>

								initSearch('http://typeahead.elsevier.com/solr/select?wt=json','20','20','ecaasstbsus')
							})();
							</script>

	$(document).ready(function() {
		
	});
